content:
TITLE: Using dfraw_json_parser CLI Command Line Options
DESCRIPTION: Complete command-line usage documentation for the dfraw_json_parser tool, showing all available options for parsing Dwarf Fortress raw files. Options include selecting specific raw types, formatting output, setting verbosity, and specifying input sources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/cli/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
Usage: dfraw-json-parser [OPTIONS] <dwarf-fortress-path>

Default behavior:
    - Parse the vanilla raws
    - Parse all object types
    - Print a summary of the parsed raws
    - Save the parsed raws to 'parsed-raws.json'
    - Log at the 'info' level

The following options are supported:
    -c, --creature      Parse creature raws
    -p, --plant         Parse plant raws
    -e, --entity        Parse entity raws
    -i, --inorganic     Parse inorganic raws
    -g, --graphics      Parse graphics raws

    -s, --summary       Print a summary of the parsed raws

    -P, --pretty        Pretty-print the parsed raws
        This is only used when saving the parsed raws to a file.

    -M, --metadata      Attach metadata to the parsed raws
        This includes the raws' file paths and other information about the
        raws' source.

    -o, --output PATH   Set the output path for the parsed raws
        Default value: 'parsed-raws.json'

    -r, --raw PATH      Parse a raw file
        This can be included multiple times to parse multiple raw files
        directly.

    -l, --legends PATH  Parse a legends export
        This can be included multiple times to parse multiple legends
        exports. These should be 'legends-plus' exports from DFHack.

    -m, --module PATH   Parse a raw module
        This can be included multiple times to parse multiple raw modules
        directly. This could be to specify a single raw module to parse, or
        to specify a raw module to parse in addition to the raw modules
        specified by the --vanilla, --mods, and --installed flags.

    -v, --verbose       Increase the verbosity of the output
        Default log level: 'info'

        This supports up to two levels of verbosity. The first level is
        'debug', and the second level is 'trace'. (e.g. '-vv' or '--verbose --verbose')

    -q, --quiet         Decrease the verbosity of the output
        Default log level: 'info'

        This supports up to two levels of verbosity. The first level is
        'warn', and the second level is 'error'. (e.g. '-qq' or '--quiet --quiet')

    --vanilla           Parse the vanilla raws
    --mods              Parse the raws from all mods
    --installed         Parse the raws from installed mods

    -h, --help              Print this help message
    -V, --version           Print the version number
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Running dfraw_json_parser CLI
DESCRIPTION: Example showing installation of the tool via Cargo and practical usage with a real Dwarf Fortress installation. The example demonstrates parsing vanilla raws from a specific path and shows the expected log output from successful parsing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/cli/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cargo install dfraw_json_parser-cli
```

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Project Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Project documentation detailing the purpose and functionality of a Dwarf Fortress raw file parser, including badges for version support and code quality checks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# dfraw_json_parser

[![supports df 50.xx](https://img.shields.io/badge/Supports%20Dwarf%20Fortress-0.50.xx-%235E3E0D?style=plastic)](https://bay12games.com/dwarves/)
[![Clippy Check](https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_json_parser/actions/workflows/clippy.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_json_parser/actions/workflows/clippy.yml)
[![OpenSSF Scorecard](https://api.securityscorecards.dev/projects/github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_json_parser/badge)](https://securityscorecards.dev/viewer/?uri=github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_json_parser)

A solution to present information about what raws are in your save game, in a searchable format.

I made this because I was playing with [Splint's Vanilla Expanded Mod](http://www.bay12forums.com/smf/index.php?topic=177593.0)
and [Primal](http://www.bay12forums.com/smf/index.php?topic=172869.15) and at the prepare carefully
screen I had no way to figure out what some of the animals were.

Yes there is the [raw explorer](http://www.bay12forums.com/smf/index.php?topic=103360) program but I found
that difficult to search with and the information was displayed in basically the same format as the raw file
itself, so it was hard to read.

## Current Functionality

Creates JSON from Dwarf Fortress raw files. This JSON can be used with the small web client to search
through, be plopped into Algolia and search or, you could simply CTRL+F or grep for what you are looking
for in the file itself. I find the JSON easier to read than the RAW txt files, and it currently doesn't
include a lot of items that were not important to me when looking up creatures. I was most concerned with
the description of the animal, if they laid eggs, if they were milkable, and how big they were.

- Parses raw files for creatures
- Parses raw files for plants
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Base Toad Creature in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: Defines the basic toad creature with attributes including physical characteristics, behaviors, attack patterns, and biological properties. Sets up the standard amphibian creature template with specific body plan and capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/creature_amphibians.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:TOAD]
	[DESCRIPTION:A squat amphibian with leathery skin, found in relatively dry areas.]
	[NAME:toad:toads:toad]
	[CASTE_NAME:toad:toads:toad]
	[CREATURE_TILE:249][COLOR:2:0:0]
	[PETVALUE:10]
	[VERMIN_GROUNDER][FREQUENCY:100][VERMIN_HATEABLE]
	[AMPHIBIOUS][SMALL_REMAINS][NO_WINTER][UNDERSWIM]
	[NATURAL][PET_EXOTIC]
	[NOT_BUTCHERABLE]
	[BIOME:ANY_POOL]
	[POPULATION_NUMBER:250:500]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Animal Person Creature Variation Definition
DESCRIPTION: Defines transformation rules to convert regular animals into humanoid versions with standard body structure. Includes removal of animal-specific attributes and addition of humanoid capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raws
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:ANIMAL_PERSON]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GENERAL_CHILD_NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GENERAL_BABY_NAME]
	[CV_CONVERT_TAG]
		[CVCT_MASTER:BODY]
		[CVCT_TARGET:QUADRUPED]
		[CVCT_REPLACEMENT:HUMANOID]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:LARGE_ROAMING]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:SAVAGE]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:CAN_LEARN]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:CAN_SPEAK]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:EQUIPS]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Giant Toad Creature Variation
DESCRIPTION: Implements a larger version of the base toad with increased size, enhanced capabilities, and mount functionality. Includes modified population parameters and movement speeds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/creature_amphibians.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:GIANT_TOAD]
	[COPY_TAGS_FROM:TOAD]
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:GIANT]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC]
	[APPLY_CURRENT_CREATURE_VARIATION]
	[GO_TO_END]
	[SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
	[CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC:100700]
	[GO_TO_START]
	[NAME:giant toad:giant toads:giant toad]
	[CASTE_NAME:giant toad:giant toads:giant toad]
	[DESCRIPTION:A huge monster in the shape of a toad.]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Toad Man Creature Variation
DESCRIPTION: Creates a humanoid variant of the toad with bipedal capabilities and human-like attributes. Includes gender variations and enhanced movement capabilities compared to the base toad.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/creature_amphibians.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:TOAD_MAN]
	[COPY_TAGS_FROM:TOAD]
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:ANIMAL_PERSON]
	[GO_TO_END]
	[SELECT_CASTE:MALE]
		[CASTE_NAME:toad man:toad men:toad man]
	[SELECT_CASTE:FEMALE]
		[CASTE_NAME:toad woman:toad women:toad woman]
	[SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced Combat Variations
DESCRIPTION: Defines specialized attacks like venomous bites, blood sucking, and stinger attacks with associated special effects and damage parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:TOOTH_BITE_VENOM_ATTACK]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK:BITE:CHILD_BODYPART_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:BY_CATEGORY:TOOTH]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_SKILL:BITE]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_VERB:bite:bites]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_CONTACT_PERC:100]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_PENETRATION_PERC:100]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_FLAG_EDGE]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_PREPARE_AND_RECOVER:3:3]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_PRIORITY:MAIN]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_FLAG_CANLATCH]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:SPECIALATTACK_INJECT_EXTRACT:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:VENOM:LIQUID:100:100]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Combat Variations
DESCRIPTION: Defines basic combat moves like punching and kicking with associated parameters for damage, recovery time, and attack priorities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:PUNCH_ATTACK]
	[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK:PUNCH:BODYPART:BY_CATEGORY:HAND]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_SKILL:GRASP_STRIKE]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_VERB:punch:punches]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_CONTACT_PERC:100]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_PREPARE_AND_RECOVER:3:3]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_PRIORITY:MAIN]
		[CV_NEW_TAG:ATTACK_FLAG_WITH]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Legless Animal Person Creature Variation Definition
DESCRIPTION: Defines transformation rules to convert regular animals into legless humanoid versions. Similar to standard animal person but with modified body structure removing legs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raws
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:ANIMAL_PERSON_LEGLESS]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GENERAL_CHILD_NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GENERAL_BABY_NAME]
	[CV_CONVERT_TAG]
		[CVCT_MASTER:BODY]
		[CVCT_TARGET:QUADRUPED]
		[CVCT_REPLACEMENT:HUMANOID_LEGLESS]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Standard Biped Movement Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Defines movement gaits for bipedal creatures including sprint, run, jog, walk, stroll, and creep speeds with associated modifiers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: dfhack
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_BIPED_GAITS]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Sprint:!ARG4:10:3:!ARG2:50:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:50]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Run:!ARG3:5:3:!ARG2:10:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:20]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Jog:!ARG2:NO_BUILD_UP:5:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:10]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Walk:!ARG1:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Stroll:!ARG5:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Creep:!ARG6:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Standard Quadruped Movement Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Defines movement gaits for four-legged creatures including gallop, canter, trot, walk, stroll, and creep speeds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: dfhack
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_QUADRUPED_GAITS]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Gallop:!ARG4:10:3:!ARG2:5:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:50]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Canter:!ARG3:5:3:!ARG2:3:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:20]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Trot:!ARG2:NO_BUILD_UP:0:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:10]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Walk:!ARG1:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Stroll:!ARG5:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:WALK:Creep:!ARG6:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Special Movement Configurations
DESCRIPTION: Defines specialized movement patterns for climbing, swimming, crawling, and flying creatures with varying speeds and modifiers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: dfhack
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_CLIMBING_GAITS]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:CLIMB:Scramble:!ARG4:10:3:!ARG2:50:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:50]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:CLIMB:Faster Climb:!ARG3:5:3:!ARG2:10:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:20]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:CLIMB:Fast Climb:!ARG2:NO_BUILD_UP:5:LAYERS_SLOW:STRENGTH:AGILITY:STEALTH_SLOWS:10]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:CLIMB:Climb:!ARG1:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:CLIMB:Slow Climb:!ARG5:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
[CV_NEW_TAG:GAIT:CLIMB:Creep:!ARG6:NO_BUILD_UP:0]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Giant Creature Variation
DESCRIPTION: Removes various default tags for giant creature variants, affecting their naming, population, appearance, and behavior characteristics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:GIANT]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GENERAL_CHILD_NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GENERAL_BABY_NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CASTE_NAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CHILDNAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:BABYNAME]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:POPULATION_NUMBER]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CLUSTER_NUMBER]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:COLOR]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:MOUNT]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:MOUNT_EXOTIC]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:SOUND]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:SMALL_REMAINS]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:DESCRIPTION]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CREATURE_TILE]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:PET]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:PETVALUE]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Creature Tag Modifications
DESCRIPTION: Initial creature tag modifications to remove default behaviors and add new characteristics. Sets size and frequency changes for all castes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/tests/data/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: dfhack
CODE:
```
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:NOT_BUTCHERABLE]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:PREFSTRING]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:SPEED]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:SWIM_SPEED]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:MUNDANE]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:GAIT]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:UBIQUITOUS]
[CV_NEW_TAG:LARGE_ROAMING]
[CV_NEW_TAG:SAVAGE]
[CV_NEW_TAG:SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
[CV_NEW_TAG:CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC:200]
[CV_NEW_TAG:CHANGE_FREQUENCY_PERC:50]
```

TITLE: Refactoring Rust Code in dfraw_parser

SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Supported Versions in Markdown Table
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows a markdown table that lists the supported versions of the dfraw_parser project for security fixes. It indicates that version 0.17.x is supported while versions below 0.16.x are not.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/SECURITY.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Version  | Supported          |
| -------- | ------------------ |
| 0.17.x   | :white_check_mark: |
| < 0.16.x | :x:                |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry for v0.3.1
DESCRIPTION: Changelog entry documenting version 0.3.1 release with new features, bug fixes and chores
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## v0.3.1 (2022-12-13)

<csr-id-373da1570664724774cddd13d34ae50c05a47dd8/>

### Chore

- <csr-id-373da1570664724774cddd13d34ae50c05a47dd8/> üîñ bump version

### New Features

 - <csr-id-a222b276b20a65f460d337235c1c5833576cda25/> ‚ú® add extra info about what kind of raw module is parsed
 - <csr-id-72fc3a666dd7c274c181f8877bc3d1bb2d2742e0/> ‚ú® send current module along with progress
 - <csr-id-0b2449691aa6895f236da1c4e2869659dba1d167/> üöÄ add feature "tauri" to emit progress

### Bug Fixes

 - <csr-id-2fbd8699570e0f1c95ef14a8903d86de3c289685/> üöëÔ∏è with final check of pct, must be initialized first
 - <csr-id-2505a5cdc04dd52e46189f26b047c55980a8f5c4/> ‚ö°Ô∏è only emit 1.0 if it hasn't already
```

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entry for v0.3.0
DESCRIPTION: Changelog entry documenting version 0.3.0 release with dependency updates, documentation changes and bug fixes
SOURCE: https://github.com/nwesterhausen/dfraw_parser/blob/main/jsonlib/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## v0.3.0 (2022-12-13)

<csr-id-0c7aebb62c9b8cae212207bddcae6edbece83995/>

### Chore

- <csr-id-0c7aebb62c9b8cae212207bddcae6edbece83995/> ‚¨ÜÔ∏è update dependencies

### Documentation

 - <csr-id-bd06df53aef97bd7a7e44276f707a58d52387541/> üìù update rustdoc
 - <csr-id-cc6ee32284b48968c361337f88d45d9059f44af6/> üìù update crates.io required documentation

## v1.2.1 (2024-05-12)

### Bug Fixes
